author: Max White
title: DeAndre Levy to undergo hip surgery
text:
Max White 1:32 PM, Oct 14, 2015 Image copyright 2014 Getty Images. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, or redistributed. Show Caption Previous Next 
DETROIT (WXYZ) - Detroit Lions Head Coach Jim Caldwell announced on Wednesday that linebacker DeAndre Levy will undergo hip surgery. 
The team said they have not yet made a determination if he will go on injured reserve. It is possible he could miss the rest of the season after the surgery. Coach Caldwell announced that DeAndre Levy will undergo surgery. A determination on whether or not he will go on IR has not been made. â€” Detroit Lions (@Lions) October 14, 2015 
Levy missed the first four games of the season with a hip injury, but started in Sunday's game against the Arizona Cardinals. 
He aggravated the injury before halftime and did not return for the rest of the game. 
During his press conference on Monday, Caldwell said Levy would consult with team doctors, who would make the final determination about what he should do. Earlier in the season, medical personnel did not think surgery was needed. 
This offseason, the linebacker signed a four-year, $33 million contract extension. 
Last season, Levy had his best year with 151 tackles, 15 tackles for loss and 2 1/2 sacks. He also had an interception and a safety.
